description: Products of pairs of consecutive refactorable numbers.
comments: The product of a pair of consecutive refactorable numbers is itself refactorable.
links: S. Colton, Refactorable Numbers - A Machine Invention, J. Integer Sequences, Vol. 2, 1999, #2.
S. Colton, HR - Automatic Theory Formation in Pure Mathematics [broken link]
example: 8 and 9 are consecutive refactorable numbers, so 8*9 = 72 is in the sequence.
prog: (PARI) isrefac(n) = ! (n % numdiv(n));lista(nn) = {for (n=1, nn, if (isrefac(n) && isrefac(n+1), print1(n*(n+1) ", ")););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Aug 31 2013
author: Simon Colton (simonco(AT)cs.york.ac.uk)
